Package jovine360.web

Class DateTime

java.lang.Object
jovine360.web.DateTime
public class DateTime extends Object
Author:
JOSSY-PC This API is designed to help with Date-Time manipulation, ranging from current date, time calculating expiry dates, and extracting day, month, year from a date String value.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentTime

      public static String getCurrentTime()
      This method is used to get the Current time. It is a static method and can be accessed via the class.

      Kindly note that this method returns the System time where it program resides e.g server time. In a web application instance, user's local current time can be gotten via a scripting code from the browser.

      Returns:
      a string value of the system current time. 
            String time = DateTime.getCurrentTime();

    • getCurrentDateTime

      public static String getCurrentDateTime()
      This method is used to get the Current Datetime. It is a static method and can be accessed via the class.

      Kindly note that this method returns the System time where it program resides e.g server time. In a web application instance, user's local current datetime can be gotten via a scripting code from the browser.

      Returns:
      a string value of the system current time. 
            String time = DateTime.getCurrentDateTime();

      public static int getDate(String date)
      This method is used to get the date from a date argument.It is a static method and can be accessed via the class.
      Parameters:
      date - represets the date argument passed for extracting the date of the month
      Returns:
      an int value of the date from the date argument passed. 
            int date = DateTime.getDate(dateObject);

    • getExpireDate

      public static String getExpireDate(String date, String dateFormat, int value)

      This method is used to generate expiry dates based the on the date object passed as parameter. it works with the getCurrentDate() method in the same package, which can be invoked/passed directly to this method or stored in a String variable object and in turn passed to this method: 

           E.g
         String date = DateTime.getCurrentDate(); from DATE package.
         String expireDate = DateTime.getExpireDate(date, "year|month|day", validPeriod);
      OR 
               String expireDate = DateTime.getExpireDate(DateTime.getCurrentDate(), "year|month|day", validPeriod);
      Parameters:
      date - represents the String object containing the date value representing the start date.
      dateFormat - is a flag representing the validity format whether its a year, month or day. it can only be any of this option with no blank space before or after, ie "year" or "month" or "day".
      value - represents the valid period in numbers depending on the dateformat specified.
      Returns:
      a String object of the newly generated date representing the expiry date.

    • getFormatLongDateSuffix

      public static String getFormatLongDateSuffix(String date, String format)
      This method is used for formatting the date value passed as a String parameter in the format passed with date suffix appended.
      Parameters:
      date - represents the date String object passed
      format - contains 3 format options ('yyyymmdd','mmddyyyy','ddmmyyyy')
      Returns:
      returns a formatted date value 
               Example:
         2016 January, 12th; // for 'yyyymmdd' format

    • getFormatLongDate

      public static String getFormatLongDate(String date, String format)
      This method is used for formatting the date value passed as a String parameter in the format passed without date suffix appended.
      Parameters:
      date - represents the date String object passed
      format - contains 3 format options ('yyyymmdd','mmddyyyy','ddmmyyyy')
      Returns:
      returns a formatted date value 
               Example:
         2016 January, 12; // for 'yyyymmdd' format

    • getExpirationValidityDaysLeft

      public static int getExpirationValidityDaysLeft(String conditionCol, String conditionVal, String column, String table, Connection konn)
      This method can be used to get valid number of days left between the current date and that from the database based on the given condition. if implements the DATEDIFF function of the sql query. It then calls the getCustomFieldValue(query, conn) method of the DataAccessObjcet in the DAO package to retrieve the String value which is then parsed and returned as int.
      Parameters:
      conditionCol - represents the column name in the WHERE clause used to fetch the date value
      conditionVal - represents the value criteria for the column name that returns the date value
      column - represents the date value field/column to be returned.
      table - represents the database table name
      konn - represents the connection object
      Returns:
      the total number of days left

    • getDateTimeSub

      public static String getDateTimeSub(String datetime, int num, String format, Connection connect)
      This method implements the SQL DATE_SUB function between the datetime argument and the specified number of day|month|year|hour|minute|seconds depending on the format specified. It then calls the getCustomFieldValue(query, conn) method of the DataAccessObjcet in the DAO package to retrieve the String value.
      Parameters:
      datetime - represents the datetime String object passed for processing.
      num - represents the total number of days|month|year|hour|min|sec to sub
      format - represents the SQL DATE_SUB format
      connect - represents the connection object
      Returns:
      a String value of the datetime

    • getDateSub

      public static String getDateSub(String date, int num, String format, Connection connect)
      This method implements the SQL DATE_SUB function between the datetime argument and the specified number of day|month|year depending on the format specified. It then calls the getCustomFieldValue(query, conn) method of the DataAccessObjcet in the DAO package to retrieve the String value.
      Parameters:
      date - represents the date String object passed for processing.
      num - represents the total number of days|month|year|hour|min|sec to sub
      format - represents the SQL DATE_SUB format
      connect - represents the connection object
      Returns:
      a String value of the date

    • getExpiryDate

      public static String getExpiryDate(String date, int num, String format, Connection connect)
      This method can be used to days|months|years to a date and returns the new date. Hence, it is useful for determining expiry dates.
      Parameters:
      date - represents the date object from which the new date will be calculated.
      num - represents the num of days|months|years to be added
      format - represents the format to determine whether it is days|months|years that will be added
      connect - represents the connection object.
      Returns:
      the new calculated date value in String

    • getExpiryDateTime

      public static String getExpiryDateTime(String datetime, int num, String format, Connection connect)
      This method can be used to days|months|years|hour|minute|seconds to a date and returns the new date. Hence, it is useful for determining expiry dates.
      Parameters:
      datetime - represents the datetime object from which the new date will be calculated.
      num - represents the num of days|months|years|hour|minute|seconds to be added
      format - represents the format to determine whether it is days|months|years|hour|minute|seconds that will be added
      connect - represents the connection object.
      Returns:
      the new calculated datetime value in String

    • get24HrTimeFormatByTime

      public static String get24HrTimeFormatByTime(String time)
      This method is used to format the time argument into the 24 hour display time.
      Parameters:
      time - represents the time String object to be formatted.
      Returns:
      a String value of 24hr formatted time. e.g 13:30 PM
